msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; several groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I, alternating with black lines; two lines in the incipit of Text II and III; incipit of each section in Text II; every second letter in some words in Text II (e.g., fols. 11rb, 32vb); the first word of each strophe in Text III; the words sälam “salutation” and sǝbḥat “glory” in Text III; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numerals.

Fol. 76ra-b: Donation note. Fol. 76ra-b: ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘተሣየጠቶ፡ በንዋያ፡ ቅድስት፡ ወህሪት፡ ወለተ፡ መድኅን፡ ወወ[ሀ]በቶ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ደንዴራ፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖ፡ መድኃኒተ፡ ነፍስ፡ ወሥጋ፡ ለአቡሃ፡ ወለእማ፡ ገብረ፡ ዮሐ[ን]ስ፡ ወለተ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ወለደቂቃ፡ ወለተ፡ አቢየ፡ እግዚእ፡ ወለተ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ዘሰረቃ፡ ወዘፋሐቃ፡ ወዘተአገላ፡ በስልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡
The note is written in brilliant vermillion ink and states that Wälättä Mädḫǝn purchased the book and donated it to the church of Mikaʾel Dändera. The note also mentions her father Gäbrä Yoḥannǝs, her mother Wälättä Gäbrǝʾel, and her daughters Wälättä ʾAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ and Wälättä Täklä Haymanot. The note concludes with a condemnation for those who stole the book.

- The title መደሃን የአለም is written on the front cover with white paint. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of a cross (+) indicating the place where the omissions, written in the left margin, belong: fol. 11va. - Omitted letters or words inserted interlineally in the main hand: e.g., fols. 4vb, 6va, 22va, 43ra, 48ra, 55vb. - Omitted letter inserted in blue pen in a secondary hand: fol. 5rb. - Erasures: fols. 20ra, 26vb, 33rb. - Erasure marked with thin red lines: fol. 44rb. - Immediate corrections indicated by thin black lines or series of dashes above and below the word(s): e.g., fols. 4vb, 5va, 10ra, 22rb, 32vb, 46vb, 50rb, 58vb. - Space for rubrication left unfilled: fol. 48va. - Unfilled line marked with thin red lines: fol. 17rb. - Notes in pencil on fols. 2r, 76v. - Several names are written in the supplication formulas in a secondary hand (possibly the same as Additio 1) in brilliant vermillion ink: Gäbrä ʾIyäsus (e.g., fols. 7rb, 11rb, 25rb, 36va, 57va), Wälättä Mädḫǝn (e.g., fols. 11rb, 19ra, 30vb, 46vb, 57va, 70va), ʾabunä Kidanä Maryam (e.g., fols. 10vb, 22ra, 32ra, 50rb, 62vb, 70va), Wälättä ʾAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ (e.g., fols. 10vb, 22ra, 28vb, 53va, 62vb, 70va), Gäbrä Yoḥannǝs (fol. 70va), Wälättä Gäbrǝʾel (fol. 70va). The name of Täsfa Ḥǝywät is crudely written in red pencil in the supplication formulas e.g., on fols. 7rb, 11rb, 15ra, 44va, 56va, 66ra, 76ra.

person.persName: Additio 1 mentions Wälättä Mädḫǝn as the one who donated the book to Dändera Mikaʾel, as well as her father Gäbrä Yoḥannǝs, her mother Wälättä Gäbrǝʾel and her daughters Wälättä ʾAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ and Wälättä Täklä Haymanot. Other names are written in a secondary hand in supplication formulas (s. Varia).
